### Education and Work Experience

I have a BA in Foreign Area Studies with a concentration in French History from Barnard College at Columbia University in New York City. I also have an MSc in European Studies from the London School of Economics, where I focused on immigration policy, and an Advanced Graduate Certificate in Data Analytics and Computational Social Science from the University of Massachusetts Amherst. I have a decade of experience working for the international NGO [Verit√©](http://verite.org), where I specialized in leading research projects on forced labor, human trafficking, and the working conditions of migrant workers in global supply chains.

### Research Interests

Using data analytics and quantitative and qualitative research methods to advance human rights and amplify social impact.
